description: Discordbot refers to automated programs on Discord servers, performing tasks like moderation, music playback, and user engagement to enhance community interactions

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_ADD_GROUP_DM_USER
tools.description: Adds a user to a Discord group Direct Message (DM) channel.

nick.title: Nick
nick.description: Nickname for the user in the group DM. Uses user's default display name if not provided.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: ID of the user to add to the group DM channel.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: ID of the group DM channel to add the user to.

access_token.title: Access Token
access_token.description: Access token of the user being added; must have the `gdm.join` OAuth2 scope.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_ADD_GUILD_MEMBER
tools.description: Adds a user (who is not already a member) to a guild using their `access_token` (which must have `guilds.join` scope), optionally setting nickname, roles, mute/deaf status, or flags.

inputSchema.title: AddGuildMemberRequest

deaf.title: Deaf
deaf.description: Whether the user should be server deafened in voice channels. Requires `DEAFEN_MEMBERS` permission for the bot if setting this.

mute.title: Mute
mute.description: Whether the user should be server muted in voice channels. Requires `MUTE_MEMBERS` permission for the bot if setting this.

nick.title: Nick
nick.description: Nickname to set for the user in this guild. If `null` or empty, no nickname is set.

flags.title: Flags
flags.description: Member flags to set. Refer to Discord API for values. Setting certain flags might require `MODERATE_MEMBERS` permission.

roles.title: Roles
roles.description: List of role IDs (strings) to assign. **Important**: Value must be a list of role ID strings, despite the schema's type hint.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: ID of the user to add.

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: ID of the guild to add the user to.

access_token.title: Access Token
access_token.description: OAuth2 access token for the user, with `guilds.join` scope, to authorize adding them to the guild.

inputSchema.description: Adds a user to a Discord guild, optionally setting initial attributes.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_ADD_GUILD_MEMBER_ROLE
tools.description: Assigns a role to a guild member, provided the bot has 'Manage Roles' permission in the guild and the role to be assigned is hierarchically lower than the bot's highest role.

role_id.title: Role Id
role_id.description: The unique identifier of the Discord role to be assigned to the member.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The unique identifier of the Discord user (member) to whom the role will be added.

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: The unique identifier of the Discord guild (server) where the member and role exist.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_ADD_MY_MESSAGE_REACTION
tools.description: Adds an emoji reaction from the authenticated user/bot to a specific message in a Discord channel; does not return information about existing reactions.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: Channel Id

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_ADD_THREAD_MEMBER
tools.description: Adds a user to a specific, unarchived thread; the user must have access to the thread's parent channel, and for private threads, the bot must already be a member.

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: The ID of the user to add to the thread.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: The ID of the thread to which the user will be added.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_BAN_USER_FROM_GUILD
tools.description: Permanently bans a user from a Discord guild, optionally deleting their recent messages (specify deletion period in seconds OR days, not both).

inputSchema.title: BanUserFromGuildRequest

user_id.title: User Id
user_id.description: Unique identifier of the Discord user to be banned.

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: Unique identifier of the Discord guild (server).

delete_message_days.title: Delete Message Days
delete_message_days.description: Number of days (0-7) of the user's past messages to delete; use this OR `delete_message_seconds`.

delete_message_seconds.title: Delete Message Seconds
delete_message_seconds.description: Number of seconds (0-604800, i.e., 7 days) of the user's past messages to delete; use this OR `delete_message_days`.

inputSchema.description: Defines the parameters for banning a user from a Discord guild.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_BULK_BAN_USERS_FROM_GUILD
tools.description: Bans up to 200 users from a Discord guild, optionally deleting their recent messages; the bot must have 'Ban Members' permission in the guild, and this action is irreversible.

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: The unique identifier of the Discord guild (server) from which users will be banned.

user_ids.title: User Ids
user_ids.description: IDs of users to ban from the guild (maximum 200).

delete_message_seconds.title: Delete Message Seconds
delete_message_seconds.description: Number of seconds of messages (0-604800, i.e., 0 seconds to 7 days) to delete for banned users. If omitted or set to 0, no messages are deleted.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_BULK_DELETE_MESSAGES
tools.description: Atomically bulk deletes messages in a Discord channel for moderation or maintenance; deletion may not be instantaneous and messages are unrecoverable.

messages.title: Messages
messages.description: A list of unique message IDs to be deleted from the specified channel. This list must contain between 2 and 100 message IDs. All messages must be less than two weeks old; older messages must be deleted individually.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: The unique identifier of the Discord channel from which messages will be deleted.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_APPLICATION_COMMAND
tools.description: Creates a new global Discord application command, accessible across guilds and in DMs (if `dm_permission` is true), noting global commands can take up to an hour to propagate and have registration limits; for guild-specific commands, use a different action.

name.title: Name
name.description: 1-32 characters. For USER and MESSAGE commands, this is the label displayed in the context menu. Must be unique for the application in its scope (global or guild).

options.title: Options
examples: [{"name": "user", "description": "The user to get info about", "type": 6, "required": true}]
options.description: For CHAT_INPUT commands: parameters or subcommands (max 25). See Discord API for option structure.

description.title: Description
examples: Get information about a server member.
description.description: 1-100 characters for CHAT_INPUT commands; displayed to user. For USER/MESSAGE commands, use empty string or omit.

dm_permission.title: Dm Permission
dm_permission.description: If command is available in DMs with the app (global commands only). Defaults to true.

application_id.title: Application Id
application_id.description: Unique ID of the Discord application.

name_localizations.title: Name Localizations
name_localizations.description: Localization dictionary for `name`, mapping locale codes to names (1-32 chars each).

description_localizations.title: Description Localizations
examples: {"es-ES": "Reproduce la canción especificada.", "fr": "Joue la chanson spécifiée."}
description_localizations.description: Localization dictionary for `description`, mapping locale codes to descriptions (1-100 chars each).

default_member_permissions.title: Default Member Permissions
default_member_permissions.description: Bitwise permission flags (string) a member needs. '0' for none. Omitted/null means usable by everyone with access.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_AUTO_MODERATION_RULE
tools.description: Creates a new auto moderation rule for a Discord guild, requiring 'MANAGE_GUILD' permission; rule parameters are passed in the JSON request body (see request schema description for body content).

inputSchema.title: CreateAutoModerationRuleRequest

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: The unique identifier of the Discord guild (server) where the auto moderation rule will be created.

inputSchema.description: Defines path parameters for creating a Discord auto moderation rule; the rule's configuration (name, event_type, trigger_type, actions, etc.) must be provided in the JSON request body.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_CHANNEL_INVITE
tools.description: Creates a new invite for the specified Discord channel, provided the bot has 'CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE' permission for that channel.

inputSchema.title: CreateChannelInviteRequest

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: The unique identifier of the Discord channel for which to create the invite.

inputSchema.description: Specifies the channel for which a Discord invite will be created.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_DM
tools.description: Creates a new direct message (DM) channel or retrieves an existing one, using `recipient_id` for a 1-on-1 DM or `access_tokens` for a group DM; this action only establishes or fetches the channel and does not send messages.

nicks.title: Nicks
nicks.description: Sets custom nicknames for users in a group DM. Keys are User IDs, values are nicknames. Only used with `access_tokens`.

recipient_id.title: Recipient Id
recipient_id.description: The User ID for a 1-on-1 DM. Use this OR `access_tokens`.

access_tokens.title: Access Tokens
access_tokens.description: OAuth2 access tokens for users in a group DM (1 to 9 others). Use this OR `recipient_id`.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_GUILD
tools.description: Creates a new Discord guild (server) with the specified name, roles, and channels; icon must be a base64 encoded 128x128 image, and if `afk_channel_id` is set, `afk_timeout` must also be set.

inputSchema.title: CreateGuildRequest

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Base64 encoded 128x128 image (JPEG, PNG, or GIF) for the guild icon.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the guild (2-100 characters).

items.title: CreateGuildrolesRequest

id.title: Id
id.description: Temporary, unique placeholder ID for the role, used to reference this role in channel permission overwrites during guild creation. Not a Discord snowflake ID. The first role defined (e.g., id 0) is for @everyone permissions.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the role.

color.title: Color
color.description: RGB color value of the role, represented as an integer. For example, red is 16711680.

hoist.title: Hoist
hoist.description: Whether the role should be displayed separately in the member list.

mentionable.title: Mentionable
mentionable.description: Whether the role is mentionable by anyone.

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.description: Bitwise value of the enabled/disabled permissions for the role. Consult the Discord API documentation for specific permission bit values (e.g., 8 for Administrator).

unicode_emoji.title: Unicode Emoji
unicode_emoji.description: The unicode emoji string to use as the icon for the role.

items.description: Defines a role to be created within the new guild.

roles.title: Roles
roles.description: Array of role objects for the new guild. The first role in this list (e.g., with placeholder ID 0) is often used to set permissions for the `@everyone` role.

region.title: Region
region.description: Voice region ID. This field is deprecated; voice regions are now handled automatically by Discord.

items.title: CreateGuildchannelsRequest

id.title: Id
id.description: Optional: A specific channel ID to assign. If provided, it must be unique within the guild. Typically omitted, allowing Discord to generate one.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the channel (1-100 characters).

nsfw.title: Nsfw
nsfw.description: Whether the channel is marked as NSFW (Not Safe For Work).

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of channel. Common types include `0` (Guild Text), `2` (Guild Voice), `4` (Guild Category), `13` (Guild Stage Voice), `15` (Guild Forum). Refer to Discord API documentation for all channel type values.

topic.title: Topic
topic.description: The channel topic (0-1024 characters for text/news channels; 0-4096 for forum/media channels).

bitrate.title: Bitrate
bitrate.description: The bitrate (in bits per second) of the voice channel (min 8000). Only applicable for voice channels.

position.title: Position
position.description: The sorting position of the channel within its category or among root channels.

parent_id.title: Parent Id
parent_id.description: The ID of the parent category for this channel. For threads, this is the ID of the parent text or forum channel. If creating a category, this should be omitted.

rtc_region.title: Rtc Region
rtc_region.description: Voice region ID for the voice channel (e.g., 'us-west'). Set to null for automatic selection. Only applicable for voice channels.

user_limit.title: User Limit
user_limit.description: The user limit of the voice channel (0 for no limit, 1-99 for a limit). Only applicable for voice channels.

items.title: CreateGuildchannelsavailableTagsRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the tag (1-20 characters).

emoji_id.title: Emoji Id
emoji_id.description: The ID of a guild's custom emoji to be used as the tag's emoji. Mutually exclusive with `emoji_name`.

moderated.title: Moderated
moderated.description: Whether this tag can only be added or removed by members with the `MANAGE_THREADS` permission.

emoji_name.title: Emoji Name
emoji_name.description: The unicode character of a standard emoji to be used as the tag's emoji. Mutually exclusive with `emoji_id`.

items.description: Defines an available tag that can be applied to a thread in a forum or media channel.

available_tags.title: Available Tags
available_tags.description: A list of available tags for threads in a forum or media channel. Maximum of 20 tags.

default_sort_order.title: Default Sort Order
default_sort_order.description: The default sort order for posts in forum and media channels. `0` for 'Latest Activity', `1` for 'Creation Date'. Null for no default.

video_quality_mode.title: Video Quality Mode
video_quality_mode.description: The camera video quality mode for the voice channel. `1` for auto, `2` for 720p. Only applicable for voice channels.

rate_limit_per_user.title: Rate Limit Per User
rate_limit_per_user.description: Amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message (0-21600). Bots and users with `manage_messages` or `manage_channel` permissions are unaffected.

default_forum_layout.title: Default Forum Layout
default_forum_layout.description: The default layout for posts in forum channels. `0` for 'Not Set', `1` for 'List View', `2` for 'Gallery View'. Null for no default.

items.title: CreateGuildchannelspermissionOverwritesRequest

id.title: Id
id.description: ID of the role or user this overwrite applies to. For role overwrites (`type` 0), this is a placeholder ID from the `roles` array. For member overwrites (`type` 1), this is a user's snowflake ID.

deny.title: Deny
deny.description: Bitwise value of permissions to deny. Consult the Discord API documentation for specific permission bit values.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of overwrite: `0` for a role or `1` for a member.

allow.title: Allow
allow.description: Bitwise value of permissions to allow. Consult the Discord API documentation for specific permission bit values.

items.description: Defines permission overwrites for a channel, specifying permissions for a role or member.

permission_overwrites.title: Permission Overwrites
permission_overwrites.description: Explicit permission overwrites for roles and members in this channel.

default_reaction_emoji.title: Default Reaction Emoji
default_reaction_emoji.description: Object containing `id` of a guild's custom emoji or `unicode_emoji` of a standard emoji, to be used as the default reaction for posts in a forum or media channel.

default_auto_archive_duration.title: Default Auto Archive Duration
default_auto_archive_duration.description: Default duration in minutes for auto-archiving threads created in this channel. Accepted values: 60, 1440, 4320, 10080. Applicable for text and news channels.

default_thread_rate_limit_per_user.title: Default Thread Rate Limit Per User
default_thread_rate_limit_per_user.description: The initial `rate_limit_per_user` to set on newly created threads in this channel. This value is copied to the thread at creation time.

items.description: Defines a channel to be created within the new guild.

channels.title: Channels
channels.description: Array of channel objects for the new guild. When specifying `permission_overwrites` within these channels, the `id` field refers to a placeholder ID from the `roles` array.

afk_timeout.title: Afk Timeout
afk_timeout.description: AFK timeout in seconds. After this period of inactivity, users will be moved to the AFK channel. Allowed values: 60, 300, 900, 1800, 3600.

description.title: Description
examples: Official server for the MyGame title.
description.description: The description for the guild, if desired.

afk_channel_id.title: Afk Channel Id
afk_channel_id.description: The ID of the channel to which AFK users are moved. Must be a voice channel. If provided, `afk_timeout` must also be set.

preferred_locale.title: Preferred Locale
preferred_locale.description: The preferred locale for a Community guild, used in server discovery and notices from Discord. Defaults to 'en-US'.

system_channel_id.title: System Channel Id
system_channel_id.description: The ID of the channel where guild system messages (e.g., welcome messages, server boost notifications) are posted.

verification_level.title: Verification Level
verification_level.description: Verification level required for the guild. `0`: None, `1`: Low (verified email), `2`: Medium (registered on Discord >5 mins), `3`: High (member of server >10 mins), `4`: Highest (verified phone).

system_channel_flags.title: System Channel Flags
system_channel_flags.description: Bitwise value of system channel flags that control which system messages are sent. Consult Discord API documentation for flag values (e.g., suppress join notifications: 1 << 0).

explicit_content_filter.title: Explicit Content Filter
explicit_content_filter.description: Explicit content filter level for the guild. `0`: Disabled, `1`: Members without roles, `2`: All members.

default_message_notifications.title: Default Message Notifications
default_message_notifications.description: Default message notification level for new members. `0`: All Messages, `1`: Only @mentions.

inputSchema.description: Specifies the parameters for creating a new Discord guild.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_GUILD_APPLICATION_COMMAND
tools.description: Creates a new guild-specific application command (slash, user, or message) in Discord; command name must be unique per type within the guild (max 100 total commands), and client UI updates may take up to an hour.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the command (1-32 characters).

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of command. Defaults to 1 (CHAT_INPUT) if not set. Other types include USER (2) and MESSAGE (3).

options.title: Options
options.description: The parameters for the command, max 25. See Discord API documentation for `ApplicationCommandOption` structure.

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: The ID of the guild (server).

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the command (1-100 characters).

dm_permission.title: Dm Permission
dm_permission.description: Indicates whether the command is available in DMs with the app. Only for globally-scoped commands.

name_localizations.title: Name Localizations
name_localizations.description: A dictionary of localizations for the command name. The keys should be valid locales, e.g. 'en-US', 'es-ES'.

description_localizations.title: Description Localizations
description_localizations.description: A dictionary of localizations for the command description. The keys should be valid locales, e.g. 'en-US', 'es-ES'.

default_member_permissions.title: Default Member Permissions
default_member_permissions.description: A bitwise OR of permissions a member needs to use this command by default. Set to 0 to disable for everyone except administrators.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_GUILD_CHANNEL
tools.description: Creates a new Discord channel (text, voice, category, etc.) within a guild, with options for permissions, topic, and type-specific settings.

name.title: Name
name.description: New channel name (2-100 characters).

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of channel (e.g., 0 for GUILD_TEXT, 2 for GUILD_VOICE). See Discord API docs for all types.

topic.title: Topic
topic.description: Channel topic (0-1024 characters for text; 0-120 for forum channels).

bitrate.title: Bitrate
bitrate.description: Bitrate (in bits) for voice channels (8000-96000; 8000-128000 for VIP servers).

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: ID of the guild (server) to create the channel in.

parent_id.title: Parent Id
parent_id.description: ID of the parent category for this channel.

rtc_region.title: Rtc Region
rtc_region.description: Voice region ID for voice channels (auto if not set). See Discord API docs for regions.

user_limit.title: User Limit
user_limit.description: Maximum users in a voice channel (0-99, 0 for no limit).

available_tags.title: Available Tags
available_tags.description: Tag objects available in a forum channel (max 20). Each tag needs `name` and can optionally include `moderated`, `emoji_id`, `emoji_name`.

default_sort_order.title: Default Sort Order
default_sort_order.description: Default sort order for forum posts: 0 for 'Latest Activity', 1 for 'Creation Date'.

video_quality_mode.title: Video Quality Mode
video_quality_mode.description: Camera video quality for voice channels: 1 for auto, 2 for 720p.

rate_limit_per_user.title: Rate Limit Per User
rate_limit_per_user.description: Seconds a user must wait before sending another message (0-21600); bots and users with MANAGE_MESSAGES or MANAGE_CHANNEL permission are unaffected. Known as slowmode. For forum channels, this sets `default_thread_rate_limit_per_user`.

default_forum_layout.title: Default Forum Layout
default_forum_layout.description: Default forum layout for displaying posts: 0 for 'Not Set', 1 for 'List View', 2 for 'Gallery View'.

items.title: CreateGuildChannelpermissionOverwritesRequest

id.title: Id
id.description: Role or user ID for the permission overwrite.

type.title: Type
type.description: Entity type for the permission overwrite: 0 for 'role', 1 for 'member'.

items.description: Request schema for `CreateGuildChannelpermissionOverwrites`

permission_overwrites.title: Permission Overwrites
permission_overwrites.description: Permission overwrite objects for the channel.

default_reaction_emoji.title: Default Reaction Emoji
default_reaction_emoji.description: Default reaction emoji for forum posts (requires `emoji_id` or `emoji_name`).

default_auto_archive_duration.title: Default Auto Archive Duration
default_auto_archive_duration.description: Default duration (minutes) for new threads to auto-archive after inactivity (60, 1440, 4320, 10080). For text/announcement channels.

default_thread_rate_limit_per_user.title: Default Thread Rate Limit Per User
default_thread_rate_limit_per_user.description: Initial `rate_limit_per_user` for new threads in text channels (not forum channels).

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_GUILD_EMOJI
tools.description: Creates a new custom emoji in a specified Discord guild, requiring `CREATE_EXPRESSIONS` permission and adherence to guild emoji limits.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name for the new emoji. Must be between 2 and 32 characters long and can only contain alphanumeric characters and underscores.

image.title: Image
image.description: The base64 encoded image data for the emoji. Must be a 128x128px GIF or PNG. For animated emojis, a GIF is required. The data must be URI encoded (e.g., 'data:image/png;base64,BASE64_ENCODED_IMAGE_DATA'). Image size should be less than 256KB.

roles.title: Roles
roles.description: An array of role IDs (strings) to which this emoji will be restricted. If omitted, `None`, or an empty list, the emoji is available to @everyone. Note: Despite the type hint, this field expects a list of string role IDs if provided.

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: The ID of the Discord guild (server) where the emoji will be created.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_GUILD_FROM_TEMPLATE
tools.description: Creates a new Discord guild by applying channels, roles, and settings from a specified, valid, and accessible guild template code.

inputSchema.title: CreateGuildFromTemplateRequest

code.title: Code
code.description: The unique code of the guild template to use.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Data URI scheme (e.g., `data:image/png;base64,...` or `data:image/jpeg;base64,...`) for the guild's 128x128 icon.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name for the new guild (must be between 2 and 100 characters).

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a new guild from a template.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_GUILD_ROLE
tools.description: Creates a new role in a Discord guild with customizable name, permissions, color, hoist, mentionability, and icon; `icon` (custom image hash) and `unicode_emoji` (standard emoji) are mutually exclusive.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Hash of a custom image for the role's icon (e.g., from a previous Discord upload). Use `unicode_emoji` for standard emojis.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name for the new role. If omitted, Discord defaults to 'new role'.

color.title: Color
color.description: RGB color value for the role (e.g., red is `16711680`). Defaults to `0` (no color) if omitted.

hoist.title: Hoist
hoist.description: If `True`, displays the role separately in the user list. Defaults to `False` if omitted.

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: ID of the Discord guild (server) where the role will be created.

mentionable.title: Mentionable
mentionable.description: If `True`, this role can be mentioned by others. Defaults to `False` if omitted.

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.description: Bitwise integer for role permissions, combined from [Discord permission flags](https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/permissions#permissions-bitwise-permission-flags) (e.g., 'Manage Channels' 0x4 + 'Kick Members' 0x2 = 6). Default permissions may apply if omitted.

unicode_emoji.title: Unicode Emoji
unicode_emoji.description: Standard Unicode emoji for the role's icon (e.g., '🎉'). Use `icon` for custom image hashes.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_GUILD_SCHEDULED_EVENT
tools.description: Creates a new scheduled event in a Discord guild; a separate JSON request body (not defined in this action's request schema model) with event details (e.g., name, type, schedule) is required, and its specific fields depend on the event's `entity_type`.

inputSchema.title: CreateGuildScheduledEventRequest

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: The unique identifier of the Discord guild where the event will be created. This ID is used as a path parameter in the API request URL.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `CreateGuildScheduledEvent`, specifying the target guild ID.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_GUILD_STICKER
tools.description: Uploads a PNG, APNG, or Lottie JSON file (max 512KB) as a new custom sticker to the specified Discord guild; requires 'Manage Expressions' permissions and sufficient server boost level for sticker slots.

file.title: File
file.description: Sticker file to upload (PNG, APNG, Lottie JSON; max 512KB; 320x320px recommended). Content is used as file part in multipart/form-data.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the sticker (2-30 characters).

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Autocomplete suggestion tags (comma-separated, max 200 characters) for the sticker; corresponds to the Discord emoji name.

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: ID of the guild to create the sticker for.

description.title: Description
examples: A very cool sticker for expressing joy
Use this when you are super excited!
description.description: Description for the sticker (empty or 2-100 characters).

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_GUILD_TEMPLATE
tools.description: Creates a template of an existing Discord guild's structure (settings, roles, channels) but not its content (e.g., messages, members).

inputSchema.title: CreateGuildTemplateRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Name for the new guild template (1-100 characters).

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: ID of the existing guild from which to create the template.

description.title: Description
examples: A template for setting up a community server.
Basic server structure with moderation channels.
description.description: Optional description for the guild template (0-120 characters).

inputSchema.description: Request to create a new guild template based on an existing guild's structure.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_INTERACTION_RESPONSE
tools.description: Sends a response to a Discord interaction (e.g., slash command, component); ensure response type is context-appropriate and initial reply is within 3 seconds.

interaction_id.title: Interaction Id
interaction_id.description: ID of the originating user interaction (e.g., slash command, button, or other component).

interaction_token.title: Interaction Token
interaction_token.description: Temporary, single-use token for responding to the interaction, valid for 15 minutes from the initial interaction event.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_MESSAGE
tools.description: Sends a message to a specified Discord channel (text, embeds, stickers, components, attachments); requires `SEND_MESSAGES` permission and one of `content`, `embeds`, `sticker_ids`, or `attachments`.

inputSchema.title: CreateMessageRequest

tts.title: Tts
tts.description: Send as a text-to-speech (TTS) message. Use sparingly.

flags.title: Flags
flags.description: Bitwise value for message flags (e.g., 4 for `SUPPRESS_EMBEDS`, 64 for `EPHEMERAL` making message visible only to invoker).

nonce.title: Nonce
nonce.description: Unique integer (0 to 2^53-1) to confirm message sending and prevent duplicates.

items.title: CreateMessageembedsRequest

url.title: Url
url.description: URL of the embed. If `type` is 'link' or 'video', this is the source URL.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of embed (e.g., 'rich', 'image', 'video'). If unspecified, Discord defaults to 'rich'.

color.title: Color
color.description: Integer representation of a hex color code for the embed's left border. E.g., red is 16711680 (0xFF0000).

image.title: Image
image.description: Image object for the embed, containing `url`, and optionally `proxy_url`, `height`, `width`.

title.title: Title
title.description: Title of the embed. Max 256 characters.

video.title: Video
video.description: Video object for the embed, containing `url`, and optionally `proxy_url`, `height`, `width`.

author.title: Author
author.description: Author object for the embed, containing `name` (max 256 chars), and optionally `url` and `icon_url`.

items.title: CreateMessageembedsfieldsRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the embed field. Max 256 characters.

value.title: Value
value.description: Value of the embed field. Max 1024 characters.

inline.title: Inline
inline.description: Whether this field should display inline.

items.description: Request schema for individual fields within a Discord message embed.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: List of embed field objects. Max 25 fields.

footer.title: Footer
footer.description: Footer object for the embed, containing `text` (max 2048 chars), and optionally `icon_url`.

provider.title: Provider
provider.description: Provider object for the embed (e.g., for video embeds), containing `name` and `url`.

thumbnail.title: Thumbnail
thumbnail.description: Thumbnail object for the embed, containing `url`, and optionally `proxy_url`, `height`, `width`.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: Timestamp of embed content, in ISO8601 format. Displayed at the bottom of the embed.

description.title: Description
examples: This embed contains details about our latest update.
description.description: Description of the embed. Max 4096 characters.

items.description: Request schema for a Discord message embed object.

embeds.title: Embeds
embeds.description: Up to 10 embed objects. Combined character count across all embed attributes must not exceed 6000.

content.title: Content
content.description: Message text (max 2000 chars). Required if `embeds`, `sticker_ids`, `components`, or `attachments` are empty.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: ID of the target channel.

components.title: Components
components.description: Message components (e.g., buttons, select menus), up to 5 action rows. See Discord API docs for structure.

items.title: CreateMessageattachmentsRequest

id.title: Id
id.description: Client-defined integer (0-indexed, as string) for ordering attachments in `multipart/form-data` uploads; replaced by a Discord Snowflake ID in the response.

filename.title: Filename
filename.description: Name of the attached file (e.g., 'image.png'). Required when sending files.

is_remix.title: Is Remix
is_remix.description: Indicates if this attachment is a remix, relevant for soundboard sounds.

description.title: Description
description.description: Accessibility description for the attachment (e.g., alt text for images). Max 1024 characters.

items.description: Request schema for attachments in a Discord message.

attachments.title: Attachments
attachments.description: Attachment objects describing files for the message. Requires `multipart/form-data` request.

sticker_ids.title: Sticker Ids
sticker_ids.description: Up to 3 IDs of stickers accessible to the bot.

allowed_mentions.title: Allowed Mentions
allowed_mentions.description: Controls which mentions in `content` ping recipients. See Discord API docs for structure if customizing.

message_reference.title: Message Reference
message_reference.description: For replying to an existing message. Requires `message_id`. See Discord API docs for full structure (includes `channel_id`, `guild_id`, `fail_if_not_exists`).

inputSchema.description: Request schema for creating a Discord message.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_STAGE_INSTANCE
tools.description: Creates a new Stage instance in a specified Stage channel for live audio events; requires `MANAGE_CHANNELS`, `MUTE_MEMBERS`, and `MOVE_MEMBERS` permissions in the channel.

topic.title: Topic
topic.description: The topic for the Stage instance. Must be between 1 and 120 characters.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: The unique ID of the Stage channel where the Stage instance will be created.

privacy_level.title: Privacy Level
privacy_level.description: The privacy level of the Stage instance. Provide `None` for the Discord API's default (GUILD_ONLY, value `2`); Discord also supports `1` (PUBLIC, deprecated).

send_start_notification.title: Send Start Notification
send_start_notification.description: Specifies if a notification should be sent to @everyone when the Stage instance starts. `True` to send, `False` to not send. If `None` or omitted, the API typically defaults to `false`.

guild_scheduled_event_id.title: Guild Scheduled Event Id
guild_scheduled_event_id.description: The ID of the Guild Scheduled Event to associate with this Stage instance, or `None` if no event is associated. The actual ID for an event is a snowflake string.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_THREAD
tools.description: Creates a new thread in a text or announcement Discord channel; requires a 'name' and optionally other details (e.g., 'auto_archive_duration', an initial 'message') in the request body.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: The ID of the Discord channel in which the new thread will be created.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_THREAD_FROM_MESSAGE
tools.description: Creates a new thread from a specific message in a Discord channel, requiring `CREATE_PUBLIC_THREADS` permission (and `SEND_MESSAGES` if in a forum/media channel).

name.title: Name
name.description: The name for the new thread (1-100 characters).

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: The ID of the channel where the message exists and the new thread will be created.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: The ID of the message from which to create the new thread.

rate_limit_per_user.title: Rate Limit Per User
rate_limit_per_user.description: Amount of seconds a user must wait before sending another message in the thread (0-21600). Bots and users with `MANAGE_MESSAGES` or `MANAGE_CHANNELS` permissions are exempt. If omitted, no user-specific rate limit is applied beyond channel defaults.

auto_archive_duration.title: Auto Archive Duration
auto_archive_duration.description: Duration in minutes after which the thread automatically archives due to inactivity. Accepted values: 60 (1 hour), 1440 (1 day), 4320 (3 days), 10080 (7 days). If omitted, it defaults to the channel's settings.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_CREATE_WEBHOOK
tools.description: Creates a webhook in a specified Discord channel for external applications to post messages, provided the caller has 'MANAGE_WEBHOOKS' permission in that channel.

inputSchema.title: CreateWebhookRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Name for the webhook (1-80 characters).

avatar.title: Avatar
avatar.description: Base64 encoded image data string for the webhook's avatar (e.g., 'data:image/jpeg;base64,...').

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: ID of the channel to create the webhook in.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_DELETE_ALL_MESSAGE_REACTIONS_BY_EMOJI

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: The unique identifier of the Discord channel containing the message.

emoji_name.description: The emoji for which all reactions should be removed. For standard Unicode emojis, provide the URL-encoded emoji character (e.g., `%F0%9F%91%8D` for 👍). For custom server emojis, use the format `name:id` (e.g., `myemote:123456789012345678`).

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_EXECUTE_GITHUB_COMPATIBLE_WEBHOOK
tools.description: Forwards GitHub event notifications to a Discord channel via a webhook configured for GitHub-formatted payloads (URL ending in `/github`).

inputSchema.title: ExecuteGithubCompatibleWebhookRequest

ref.title: Ref
ref.description: Git reference involved in the event (e.g., 'refs/heads/main', 'refs/tags/v1.0.0').

wait.title: Wait
wait.description: Waits for message confirmation before responding if true; otherwise, responds immediately.

issue.title: Issue
issue.description: GitHub issue object; must be `null` if included, as complex objects are stubbed in this schema.

action.title: Action
action.description: Type of action that triggered the GitHub event (e.g., 'opened', 'created').

answer.title: Answer
answer.description: Answer within a GitHub Discussion; must be `null` if included, as complex objects are stubbed in this schema.

forced.title: Forced
forced.description: Indicates if a Git push was a force push.

forkee.title: Forkee
forkee.description: Forkee (new repository) in a GitHub 'fork' event; must be `null` if included, as complex objects are stubbed in this schema.

member.title: Member
member.description: GitHub member object; must be `null` if included, as complex objects are stubbed in this schema.

review.title: Review
review.description: GitHub pull request review object; must be `null` if included, as complex objects are stubbed in this schema.

comment.title: Comment
comment.description: GitHub comment object; must be `null` if included, as complex objects are stubbed in this schema.

items.title: ExecuteGithubCompatibleWebhookcommitsRequest

url.title: Url
url.description: GitHub URL where the commit can be viewed.

author__name.title: Author  Name
author__name.description: Display name of the commit author.

author__username.title: Author  Username
author__username.description: GitHub username of the commit author.

items.description: Represents a single commit object, typically used within a list of commits for a GitHub 'push' event payload.

commits.title: Commits
commits.description: List of commit details, primarily for 'push' events.

compare.title: Compare
compare.description: URL to view the comparison of changes, typically for a 'push' event.

release.title: Release
release.description: GitHub release object; must be `null` if included, as complex objects are stubbed in this schema.

ref_type.title: Ref Type
ref_type.description: Type of the Git reference in 'ref' (e.g., 'branch', 'tag').

check_run.title: Check Run
check_run.description: GitHub Check Run object; must be `null` if included, as complex objects are stubbed in this schema.

thread_id.title: Thread Id
thread_id.description: ID of the target Discord thread for the message; if unspecified, posts to the main channel.

discussion.title: Discussion
discussion.description: GitHub Discussion object; must be `null` if included, as complex objects are stubbed in this schema.

repository.title: Repository
repository.description: GitHub repository object; must be `null` if included, as complex objects are stubbed in this schema.

sender__id.title: Sender  Id
sender__id.description: Numeric ID of the GitHub user/application that triggered the event.

check_suite.title: Check Suite
check_suite.description: GitHub Check Suite object; must be `null` if included, as complex objects are stubbed in this schema.

head_commit.title: Head Commit
head_commit.description: Head commit object in a GitHub 'push' event; must be `null` if included, as complex objects are stubbed in this schema.

pull_request.title: Pull Request
pull_request.description: GitHub pull request object; must be `null` if included, as complex objects are stubbed in this schema.

sender__login.title: Sender  Login
sender__login.description: GitHub username (login) of the user/application that triggered the event.

sender__html__url.title: Sender  Html  Url
sender__html__url.description: URL to the GitHub profile of the event sender.

sender__avatar__url.title: Sender  Avatar  Url
sender__avatar__url.description: URL of the event sender's GitHub avatar.

inputSchema.description: Defines the request payload for executing a Discord webhook with GitHub-compatible event data.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_EXECUTE_SLACK_COMPATIBLE_WEBHOOK
tools.description: Sends richly formatted messages to Discord via its Slack-compatible webhook endpoint; requires at least one of `text` or `attachments` and adherence to content limits.

inputSchema.title: ExecuteSlackCompatibleWebhookRequest

text.title: Text
text.description: The main message content, up to 2000 characters. Supports Slack's `mrkdwn` formatting (e.g., `*bold*`, `_italic_`, `~strike~`, code, `>quote`). At least one of `text`, `attachments`, or `embeds` (via attachments) is required.

wait.title: Wait
wait.description: If true, the endpoint will wait for server confirmation of message send before responding and will return the created message object. Defaults to false.

icon_url.title: Icon Url
icon_url.description: If provided, this URL will be used for the avatar icon, overriding the default webhook icon. Must be a valid image URL.

username.title: Username
username.description: If provided, this username will override the default username associated with the webhook. Limited to 80 characters.

thread_id.title: Thread Id
thread_id.description: The ID of the target thread within the channel to send the message to. If not provided, the message is sent to the main channel.

webhook_id.title: Webhook Id
webhook_id.description: The unique identifier for the Discord webhook. This is part of the webhook URL.

items.title: ExecuteSlackCompatibleWebhookattachmentsRequest

ts.title: Ts
ts.description: A Unix timestamp (integer) representing the time of the event, displayed in the attachment.

text.title: Text
text.description: The primary text content of the attachment. Supports Slack's `mrkdwn` formatting. Limited to 4000 characters.

color.title: Color
color.description: A hex color code (e.g., `#36a64f`) or one of `good` (green), `warning` (yellow), `danger` (red) to set the color of the left border of the attachment.

title.title: Title
title.description: The main title for the attachment block. Limited to 256 characters.

items.title: ExecuteSlackCompatibleWebhookattachmentsfieldsRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: The title for this field, displayed prominently. Limited to 256 characters.

value.title: Value
value.description: The text content for this field. Limited to 1024 characters.

inline.title: Inline
inline.description: If true, this field may be displayed side-by-side with other inline fields. Defaults to false.

items.description: Defines a field object within a Slack attachment, typically displayed in a two-column layout.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: An array of field objects, each defining a piece of data to be displayed in a tabular format within the attachment. Up to 25 fields are allowed.

footer.title: Footer
footer.description: Text to display at the bottom of the attachment, often used for context or source information. Limited to 2048 characters.

pretext.title: Pretext
pretext.description: Optional text that appears above the attachment block. Supports Slack's `mrkdwn` formatting. Limited to 2000 characters.

image_url.title: Image Url
image_url.description: A URL for a larger image to be displayed within the attachment. Must be a valid image URL.

thumb_url.title: Thumb Url
thumb_url.description: A URL for a smaller image (thumbnail) to be displayed to the right of the attachment content. Must be a valid image URL.

title_link.title: Title Link
title_link.description: A URL to which the `title` text will link. Must be a valid URL.

author_icon.title: Author Icon

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_PREVIEW_PRUNE_GUILD
tools.description: Previews the number of members that would be pruned from a Discord guild based on inactivity days and optional roles; this action only returns a count and does not remove members.

days.title: Days
days.description: Number of days of inactivity (1-30 inclusive). Members inactive for at least this many days are eligible for pruning. Defaults to 7 (API default).

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: The unique identifier of the Discord guild (server) for which to preview the prune operation.

include_roles.title: Include Roles
include_roles.description: Filters prune count by role IDs. If empty/not provided, API default role filtering applies. The Discord API expects comma-delimited role IDs; due to `t.List[None]`, the exact mechanism for passing these IDs is implementation-specific.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_PRUNE_GUILD
tools.description: Removes inactive members from a Discord guild, requiring 'KICK_MEMBERS' permission; use `compute_prune_count=True` to preview results before actual removal.

days.title: Days
days.description: Number of inactivity days (1-30, default 7) before pruning members.

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: ID of the Discord guild (server) for member pruning.

include_roles.title: Include Roles
include_roles.description: Optional list of role IDs to restrict pruning to members with any of these roles.

compute_prune_count.title: Compute Prune Count
compute_prune_count.description: If true (default false), simulates prune and returns count without removing members.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_PUT_GUILDS_ONBOARDING
tools.description: Configures or updates a Discord guild's new member onboarding flow, including defining prompts with options, assigning roles/channels, setting default channels, and managing the flow's active status.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Onboarding mode; its value must be `null` (Discord-managed). See `OnboardingMode` docs for internal integer modes.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: If true, the guild's onboarding flow is active.

items.title: PutGuildsOnboardingpromptsRequest

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique ID (Snowflake) for this prompt. Use an existing ID to update; Discord assigns IDs for new prompts.

type.title: Type
type.description: Prompt type; its value must be `null` (Discord-managed). See `OnboardingPromptType` docs for internal integer types.

title.title: Title
examples: What brings you to our server?
title.description: Title for the onboarding prompt, max 100 characters.

items.title: PutGuildsOnboardingpromptsoptionsRequest

id.title: Id
id.description: Option identifier; its value must be `null` as Discord assigns it.

title.title: Title
title.description: Title for the option, max 100 characters.

emoji_id.title: Emoji Id
emoji_id.description: Custom emoji identifier; its value must be `null` if not using a custom emoji or for standard Unicode emojis.

role_ids.title: Role Ids

emoji_name.title: Emoji Name
emoji_name.description: Name of the emoji (Unicode character or custom emoji name).

channel_ids.title: Channel Ids
channel_ids.description: Channel IDs (Snowflake) the user accesses or is recommended if this option is selected.

description.title: Description
examples: Share your artwork and get feedback.

emoji_animated.title: Emoji Animated
emoji_animated.description: Indicates if the custom emoji is animated.

items.description: Request schema for `PutGuildsOnboardingpromptsoptions`

options.title: Options
options.description: Options for this prompt; must contain 1 to 25 options.

required.title: Required
required.description: If true, this prompt is mandatory.

in_onboarding.title: In Onboarding
in_onboarding.description: If true, this prompt is active in the onboarding flow.

single_select.title: Single Select
single_select.description: If true, user selects one option; otherwise, multiple.

items.description: Request schema for `PutGuildsOnboardingprompts`

prompts.title: Prompts
prompts.description: Up to 5 onboarding prompts for the guild.

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: Guild's unique ID (Snowflake) for which onboarding settings are being updated.

default_channel_ids.title: Default Channel Ids
default_channel_ids.description: Up to 7 channel IDs (Snowflake) new members join/are recommended post-onboarding.

channel_id.title: Channel Id
channel_id.description: The unique identifier of the Discord channel where the permission overwrite will be applied.

overwrite_id.title: Overwrite Id

tools.description: Updates a Discord application's settings using its `application_id`; `max_participants` requires the `APPLICATION_EMBEDDED_ACTIVITIES` flag, and `team_id`, `type`, or `install_params` must be `null` if specified.

flags.description: Bitwise value for application flags; consult Discord API for flag meanings.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: Team ID; if provided, must be `null` to transfer ownership or disassociate from a team.

cover_image.title: Cover Image
cover_image.description: Base64 encoded cover image (PNG, JPEG, or GIF).

application_id.title: Application Id
application_id.description: Unique identifier of the Discord application to update.

install_params.description: OAuth2 installation parameters; if provided, must be `null` to reset or clear existing defaults.

max_participants.title: Max Participants
max_participants.description: Maximum participants for an activity; requires `APPLICATION_EMBEDDED_ACTIVITIES` flag.

custom_install_url.description: Custom URL for redirection after authorization, bypassing default OAuth2 completion.

description__default.description: Default description if localized version is unavailable for the user's client.

interactions_endpoint_url.description: HTTPS URL for Discord to send interaction events (e.g., slash commands).

description__localizations.title: Description  Localizations
description__localizations.description: Dictionary of localized descriptions; keys are locale strings (e.g., 'en-US', 'de').

role_connections_verification_url.description: URL for verifying linked roles in role connections.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_UPDATE_APPLICATION_COMMAND
tools.description: Updates specified properties of a Discord application command (e.g., name, description); omitted properties remain unchanged, and the `options` field, if provided, overwrites all existing options.

name.title: Name
name.description: The new name for the command (1-32 characters).

options.title: Options
options.description: The new list of [application command options](https://discord.com/developers/docs/interactions/application-commands#application-command-object-application-command-option-structure) for the command. If provided, all existing options will be overwritten. An empty list will remove all options. Required options must be listed before optional ones.

command_id.title: Command Id
command_id.description: The unique identifier of the command to be updated.

description.title: Description
description.description: The new description for the command (1-100 characters). For USER and MESSAGE commands, this should be an empty string if provided.

dm_permission.title: Dm Permission
dm_permission.description: Indicates whether the command is available in DMs with the app. If `null` or not set, it will inherit the application's default DM permission configuration.

application_id.title: Application Id
application_id.description: The unique identifier of the Discord application.

name_localizations.title: Name Localizations
name_localizations.description: A dictionary mapping [locale strings](https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#locales) to localized names for the command.

description_localizations.title: Description Localizations
description_localizations.description: A dictionary mapping [locale strings](https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#locales) to localized descriptions for the command.

default_member_permissions.title: Default Member Permissions
default_member_permissions.description: An integer representing the bitwise OR-ed set of [permission flags](https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/permissions#permissions-bitwise-permission-flags) required for a member to use this command by default. For example, 8 for Administrator. Set to 0 to disable for everyone except admins by default.

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_UPDATE_APPLICATION_USER_ROLE_CONNECTION
tools.description: Updates the authorized user's role connection for a specific application, which must have a linked role connection configured.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: A dictionary of custom metadata. Values must be strings. Keys can be up to 100 characters and values up to 1000 characters. There can be up to 5 metadata fields.

platform_name.title: Platform Name
platform_name.description: The name of the external platform (e.g., Twitch, GitHub).

platform_username.title: Platform Username
platform_username.description: The user's username on the external platform.

features.title: Features
features.description: List of guild feature strings to enable/disable (e.g., 'COMMUNITY', 'DISCOVERABLE'); requires 'MANAGE_GUILD' permission or specific server status.

guild_id.description: Identifier of the guild to update.

owner_id.title: Owner Id

description.title: Description

description.description: New description for the guild; null to remove.

home_header.title: Home Header
home_header.description: Base64 encoded image for home header (requires 'COMMUNITY' feature); null to remove.

afk_channel_id.title: Afk Channel Id
afk_channel_id.description: ID of the new AFK channel; null to disable.

discovery_splash.title: Discovery Splash
discovery_splash.description: Base64 encoded 16:9 image for guild discovery splash (requires 'DISCOVERABLE' feature); null to remove.

preferred_locale.title: Preferred Locale
preferred_locale.description: New preferred locale for server discovery and Discord notices (e.g., 'en-US', 'es-ES').

rules_channel_id.title: Rules Channel Id
rules_channel_id.description: ID of the channel for server rules (requires 'COMMUNITY' feature); null to disable.

system_channel_id.title: System Channel Id
system_channel_id.description: ID of the channel for guild notices (e.g., welcome messages, server boosts); null to disable.

verification_level.title: Verification Level
verification_level.description: New verification level (integer; e.g., 0: None, 1: Low, 2: Medium, 3: High, 4: Very High).

system_channel_flags.title: System Channel Flags
system_channel_flags.description: New system channel flags (integer; e.g., suppress join notifications, suppress premium subscription notifications).

explicit_content_filter.title: Explicit Content Filter
explicit_content_filter.description: New explicit content filter level (integer; e.g., 0: Disabled, 1: Members without roles, 2: All members).

safety_alerts_channel_id.title: Safety Alerts Channel Id
safety_alerts_channel_id.description: ID of the channel for Discord safety alerts; null to disable.

public_updates_channel_id.title: Public Updates Channel Id
public_updates_channel_id.description: ID of the channel for Discord notices to admins/moderators of Community guilds; null to disable.

premium_progress_bar_enabled.title: Premium Progress Bar Enabled
premium_progress_bar_enabled.description: Enable/disable the premium progress bar for the guild.

default_message_notifications.title: Default Message Notifications
default_message_notifications.description: New default message notification level (integer; e.g., 0: All Messages, 1: Only @mentions).

tools.description: Updates a specific Discord application command's properties (like name, description, options, or permissions) within a given guild; `application_id`, `guild_id`, and `command_id` must refer to valid entities.

command_id.title: Command Id

examples: Sets a reminder for a specific user.
Fetches the current weather forecast for a given city.

dm_permission.title: Dm Permission

name_localizations.title: Name Localizations

examples: {"es-ES": "Establece un recordatorio para un usuario específico.", "fr": "Définit un rappel pour un utilisateur spécifique."}

tools.description: Updates a custom emoji's name and/or role restrictions in a Discord guild; cannot create or delete emojis, and role updates for managed emojis may be restricted by their integration.

roles.title: Roles

If this field is `null` (or not provided, as `default=None`), the emoji's role restrictions remain unchanged. Each element in the list should be a string representing a role ID.

emoji_id.title: Emoji Id

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_UPDATE_GUILD_MEMBER
tools.description: Updates a guild member's attributes (e.g., nickname, roles, voice state); if moving via `channel_id`, it must be a valid voice channel in the guild.

deaf.title: Deaf

mute.title: Mute
mute.description: Server mutes the member in voice channels. Requires the MUTE_MEMBERS permission.

nick.title: Nick
nick.description: New nickname for the guild member; `null` or an empty string removes the nickname.

flags.title: Flags
flags.description: Guild member flags (integer), e.g., `BYPASSES_VERIFICATION` (1), `SUPPRESS_ROLES` (4). Consult Discord API documentation for details on member flags.

roles.title: Roles
roles.description: List of role IDs (as strings) to assign. Replaces all existing roles. An empty list removes all roles.

user_id.title: User Id

guild_id.title: Guild Id
guild_id.description: Unique identifier of the Discord guild (server).

video.title: Video

footer.description: Footer information. Set to null to remove existing. Expected structure for setting: {'text', 'icon_url'}.

thumbnail.description: Thumbnail information. Set to null to remove existing. Expected structure for setting: {'url', 'proxy_url', 'height', 'width'}.

examples: This is a detailed description of the embed content.

channel_id.description: ID of the channel where the message is located.

components.title: Components

tools.name: DISCORDBOT_UPDATE_MY_APPLICATION
tools.description: Modifies settings for the current authenticated Discord application (e.g., description, icon, interaction URLs); setting `team_id` to `null` (None) transfers team ownership, while `null` (None) for `type` or `install_params` clears/resets them.

tags.description: List of up to 5 tags describing the application (max 20 characters per tag).

flags.description: Bitwise [application flags](https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/application#application-object-application-flags) value. Consult Discord's documentation for specific flag values.

team_id.description: Team ID of the application owner. If provided, must be `null` (None in Python) to transfer ownership of a team-owned app to the current user.

cover_image.title: Cover Image

max_participants.title: Max Participants

Provide new image data to set/update the avatar.

url.description: URL for the embed, often used with 'link' type embeds or as the target for the embed's title.
